Literature Review: Particle rafts and armored droplets are complex systems that exhibit unique characteristics due to the interactions between non-Brownian particles at interfaces. The formation of these systems is influenced by various factors, including the size and shape of the particles, the interfacial tension, and the external forces applied to the system. In this review, we will discuss the recent efforts in investigating the formation and properties of particle rafts and armored droplets, and highlight the open questions that need to be addressed to understand the fundamental physics of these systems.
